paragraph.paragraph:
To reparent an
/tools/eiffelbuild/reference/02_notation.xml#object object , you need to
/tools/eiffelbuild/reference/02_notation.xml#pick_and_drop pick the
/tools/eiffelbuild/reference/02_notation.xml#object object and
/tools/eiffelbuild/reference/02_notation.xml#pick_and_drop drop it on the
/tools/eiffelbuild/reference/02_notation.xml#object object you wish it to be parented in. The
/tools/eiffelbuild/reference/02_notation.xml#object object will be removed from its current parent, and inserted in the new parent at the next available position.

When an
/tools/eiffelbuild/reference/02_notation.xml#object object is inserted into a parent, it is always added at the next available position. If you wish to place an
/tools/eiffelbuild/reference/02_notation.xml#object object at a particular position within a parent, you must hold down the Shift key, and drop on an
/tools/eiffelbuild/reference/02_notation.xml#object object already contained in parent, Your
/tools/eiffelbuild/reference/02_notation.xml#object object will then be inserted in the parent, in the position preceding the child
/tools/eiffelbuild/reference/02_notation.xml#object object that you dropped on.

You can access
/tools/eiffelbuild/reference/02_notation.xml#object objects from both the
/tools/eiffelbuild/reference/60_builder_window/index builder window and
/tools/eiffelbuild/reference/20_layout_constructor/index layout constructor .
paragraph.note: Note Although window and dialog objects may be accessed within the window selector, it is not possible to build into these objects, you should use the layout constructor or builder window directly in this situation.
paragraph.paragraph:
For more information about an
/tools/eiffelbuild/reference/02_notation.xml#object objects capacity and permitted children, see the
/libraries/vision2/00_introduction.xml EiffelVision2 documentation.
